name: Nrupatunga Betta
location: Located at Unkal Hill, Vidya Nagar / Station Road area
desc: A popular hilltop destination offering panoramic views of the twin cities of Hubli-Dharwad. It's a great spot for picnics, morning walks, and watching the sunset.

name: Unkal Lake
desc: A large, picturesque lake over 110 years old, featuring a statue of Swami Vivekananda in the center. Boating facilities are available, making it a popular evening spot.

name: Siddharoodha Math
location: Karwar Road, Srinivas Nagar, Old Hubli
desc: A prominent spiritual center and monastery dedicated to Shri Siddharoodha Swamy, a renowned philosopher. It attracts devotees from all over the country.

name: Indira Gandhi Glass House Garden
desc: A public park modeled after the Lalbagh in Bangalore. It features a large central glass house, landscaped gardens, and musical fountain shows in the evening.
best_time_to_visit: Evening (5:00 PM - 8:00 PM) for fountain show

name: Chandramouleshwara Temple
desc: An ancient, 900-year-old temple from the Chalukyan era, dedicated to Lord Shiva. It is noted for its intricate stone carvings and historical architecture.

name: ISKCON Sri Krishna Balarama Temple
desc: A magnificent temple complex similar to the one in Bangalore. Known for its 'Akshaya Patra' mid-day meal program and grand architecture.
best_time_to_visit: Morning (6:00 AM - 9:00 AM) or Evening (5:00 PM - 8:00 PM)

name: Navagraha Teertha
desc: A major pilgrimage site for the Jain community, featuring a 61-foot tall statue of Shri Parshwanatha, the tallest monolithic statue of this deity in the world.

name: Banashankari Temple
desc: Another ancient temple from the Chalukyan period, dedicated to Goddess Banashankari. It is known for its historical and cultural importance.

name: Gufha Restaurant
location: Inside The President Hotel, Munneshwar Nagar
desc: Famous for its unique cave-themed interiors, serving a wide range of Indian and multi-cuisine dishes. A popular spot for family dinners.

name: Gurudatta Bhavan
desc: A long-standing and iconic vegetarian restaurant, famous for its authentic South Indian breakfast (idli, vada, dosa) and North Karnataka meals.

name: Niyaz Restaurant
desc: Highly regarded for its traditional non-vegetarian fare, especially its Biryani and other Mughlai/Indian dishes.

name: Hotel Metropolis
location: New Hubli, near the Railway Station
desc: A well-known hotel with a popular restaurant that serves a mix of North Indian, South Indian, and Chinese cuisines.

name: Barbeque Nation
desc: Part of the popular national chain, known for its live-on-the-table grills and extensive buffet spread.

name: Government Central Library, Hubli
desc: The main public city library, offering a large collection of books, newspapers, and reading rooms for the public.

name: Public Library
desc: Another branch of the public library system, easily accessible from the railway station area.

name: Central Library
desc: Located in the educational hub of Vidya Nagar, this library is frequented by students.

name: Ashok Nagar Library
desc: A neighborhood branch library serving the residents of Ashok Nagar.

name: Vidya Poshak Library
desc: A library run by the Vidya Poshak NGO, primarily aimed at supporting students with academic and reference materials.

name: Durgad Bail
desc: A bustling, traditional market area and the commercial heart of Hubli, famous for a wide variety of goods, from textiles to electronics.

name: Hubballi Market (Subhash Road)
desc: Known for textiles, jewelry, fresh produce, and local handicrafts. A great place to experience local culture.

name: Karnataka Institute of Medical Sciences (KIMS)
desc: A premier government medical college and hospital.

name: KLE Technological University (formerly BVB College)
desc: One of the leading engineering and technical universities in Karnataka.

name: Hubli Railway Museum
desc: A well-maintained museum showcasing the history of the South Western Railway. It features two old cottages with exhibits, a model railway, and several outdoor exhibits including old locomotives and carriages. It's an underrated spot for families and railway enthusiasts.

name: Utsav Rock Garden
location: Gotagodi, Shiggaon (on NH-4, about 30km from Hubli)
desc: While not in Hubli city, it's a must-visit nearby. It's a contemporary sculpture garden depicting rural life, culture, and traditions of North Karnataka. It's a fantastic, large-scale art project.

name: Country Club Water World
desc: One of the few water parks in the region, this spot is often overlooked by tourists. It offers water slides, a wave pool, and other recreational activities, making it a good spot for a family day trip.

name: Agadi Thota
desc: An agricultural farm converted into a cultural resort. It offers a complete North Karnataka rural experience, including authentic 'Jolada Rotti' meals, bullock cart rides, and folk music. It's a day-long ethnic experience.

name: Chigari Bus (HDBRTS)
desc: The 'Chigari' is the dedicated Bus Rapid Transit System (BRTS) connecting Hubli and Dharwad. It is the fastest and most economical way to travel between the twin cities. It uses a QR code or Smart Card system. Minimum fare estimate: ₹10 - ₹15, max fare estimate: ₹35 - ₹45.

name: Local Bus (NWKRTC)
desc: These are the regular city buses that run on non-BRTS routes within Hubli and Dharwad. Minimum fare: ₹10, average fare: ₹15 - ₹20.

name: Auto Rickshaw (CRA)
desc: The most common transport for short-distance, point-to-point travel within the city. Minimum fare: ₹30 for 1.6 km, ₹15 per km after first 1.6 km. Night surcharge (10:00 PM to 5:00 AM) is 1.5x the meter fare.

name: Around Unkal Lake
desc: A popular and scenic route. The service road and pathways around the lake are ideal for morning or evening cycling. A 'Savari' public bicycle hub is located here.

name: Nrupatunga Betta
desc: A challenging but rewarding uphill ride. The road to the top is well-maintained, and the view from the summit is a great payoff. There is a 'Savari' hub at the base (Nrupatunga Betta cross).
